result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose E Benitez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jose E Benitez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jose E Benitez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample (pay the surcharge).
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No contact with victim without the approval of the Court or agent.
Court will allow for 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by the agent.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose E Benitez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jose E Benitez in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:  

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/13/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-No contact with victim without the approval of the Court or agent.
-Court will allow for 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by the agent.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide a DNA sample (pay the surcharge).
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.


Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Jose E Benitez in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jose E Benitez in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-18-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
Defendant Jose E Benitez in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1233 South 71st Street, West Allis, WI 53214
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jayme F. and her children or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Jose E Benitez in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.04  for a Status Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/13/15 @ 1:30pm
